Description: Define project scope, create backlog, plan release.
Organize Product Backlog into prioritized items, add acceptance criteria.
The development team is formed and committed to the Sprint Goal.
Determine what can be delivered in the first Sprint, create Sprint Backlog.
Set clear goals for the Sprint.
The Scrum Team iteratively improves and refines a vertical slice of the product increment.
Conduct daily Scrum meetings to inspect progress, plan next day's work.
Review the completed product increment in preparation for release.

Step: Product Increment is Shown to Stakeholders
Description: Demonstrate and discuss the product increment with stakeholders.
The Product Owner updates Release Plan based on the progress of work during the Sprint.
Scrum Team reflects on the Sprint and identifies improvements for future Sprints.
Helps the Scrum Team identify the most impactful changes.
Determine what can be delivered in the next Sprint, plan new Sprint.
Set clear goals for the upcoming Sprint.
Automated testing and deployment of the product increment.
